p: The powdered leaves are used as an effective natural flea and tick repellent. Activity against certain bacteria including Staphylcoccus aureus, Staphylococcus albus, Vibrio cholerae, Escherichia coli, and Corynebacterium has been observed. One study found that rosemary oil is most active against “meat spoiling” Gram-negative ( Pseudomonas) and Gram-positive ( Lactobacillus) bacteria [ 49].
